works.description:
THE FOLLOWING TEXT WAS COPIED FROM http://www.praxiom.com/iso-90003-intro.htm (see top of page) TO http://www.mfk.unideb.hu/userdir/dmk/docs/20072/07_2_03.pdf (see your page 38, 39):

“ISO IEC 90003:2004 was officially published on February 15, 2004. This new standard
cancels and replaces the old ISO 9000-3:1997 software standard. The old ISO 9000-3
standard explained how ISO9001:1994 could be applied to computer software. Similarly,
the new ISO 90003 standard explains how ISO 9001:2000 can be applied to computer
software. Since ISO 9000-3 was designed to be used with the old ISO 9001:1994
standard, it had to be updated to make it compatible with the new ISO 9001:2000
standard.”

THE FOLLOWING TEXT WAS COPIED FROM http://www.praxiom.com/iso-13485-intro.htm (see ISO 13485 VERSUS ISO 9001 paragraph 2) TO http://www.mfk.unideb.hu/userdir/dmk/docs/20072/07_2_03.pdf (see your page 38, 39):

“... ISO 13485 ... includes a special set of requirements specifically related to the supply of
medical devices and related services. In general, ISO13485 is made up of two kinds of
requirements: old ISO 9001 requirements and new requirements that are specifically
related to medical devices and associated services.”

THE FOLLOWING TEXT WAS COPIED FROM http://www.praxiom.com/iso-22000-intro.htm (see top of page) TO http://www.mfk.unideb.hu/userdir/dmk/docs/20072/07_2_03.pdf (see your page 38, 39):

“ISO 22000 is a generic food safety management system standard. It defines a set of
general food safety requirements that apply to all organizations in the food chain. These
requirements are listed in sections 4, 5, 6, 7, and 8 of ISO 22000.”
